meanings.definition: The act of dividing or classifying into two distinct groups or categories.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's dichotomizations of the students into two teams made the game more exciting.
meanings.sent2: The dichotomizations of the data into positive and negative categories helped in analysis.
meanings.sent3: The dichotomizations of the cookies into chocolate chip and oatmeal raisin caused a delicious dilemma.
meanings.sent4: Her dichotomizations of life as a series of ups and downs resonated with many.
meanings.sent5: The dichotomizations of the forest into light and shadow created a beautiful contrast.

meanings.definition: The process of creating a division or contrast between two opposing ideas or concepts.
meanings.sent1: The dichotomizations between tradition and innovation are often debated in the company.
meanings.sent2: His dichotomizations of good and evil shaped his moral compass.
meanings.sent3: The dichotomizations of cats as lazy and dogs as active can be quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The dichotomizations of love as a battlefield can be seen in many songs.
meanings.sent5: The dichotomizations of the painting into light and dark added depth to the artwork.
